lash.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to tie something tightly to something else with a rope
lash.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: The oars were lashed to the sides of the boat.
lash.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: if the wind, sea etc lashes something, it hits it with violent force
lash.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Giant waves lashed the sea wall.
The wind lashed violently against the door.
lash.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to hit a person or animal very hard with a whip, stick etc
lash.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: Oliver lashed the horses to go faster.
lash.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: if an animal lashes its tail, or if its tail lashes, it moves it from side to side quickly and strongly, especially because it is angry

lash.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: a hit with a whip, especially as a punishment
lash.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: They were each given fifty lashes.
lash.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: one of the hairs that grow around the edges of your eyes
lash.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: a sudden or violent movement like that of a whip
